meanings.definition: Pycnoses: the plural form of pycnosis, a type of cell death characterized by condensation of the chromatin within the nucleus.
meanings.sent1: The scientist observed the pycnoses in the cells under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The pycnoses of the cells indicated a significant level of damage.
meanings.sent3: The pycnoses party in the nucleus was a real hit among the cell organelles.
meanings.sent4: The pycnoses of the chromatin was like a dense fog enveloping the nucleus.
meanings.sent5: The pycnoses were like tiny black holes sucking in all the cell's energy.

meanings.definition: Pycnoses: the act of undergoing pycnosis, a process of cell death.
meanings.sent1: The pycnoses of the cells were evident under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: After the treatment, the pycnoses of the cells increased.
meanings.sent3: The pycnoses marathon was a unique event in the cell world.
meanings.sent4: The pycnoses of the cells was a silent but powerful force.
meanings.sent5: The pycnoses danced through the cells, leaving a trail of destruction behind.
